724133f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Watts Street
724133f-a.text:
449 to 445 Washington Street, east side, between Watts and Desbrosses Streets, as seen through a vacant lot at the S.W. corner of Watts Street. The latter has recently been cleared and was the site of three buildings,
numbered 454 to 450 Washington Street.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
724133f-a.folder: Washington Street & Watts Street, Manhattan, NY

724134f-b.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Watts Street
724134f-b.text:
(1)
Washington Street, west side, north from and including Watts Street and showing an empty lot at the S.W. corner of same; formerly the site of Nos. 450 to 454. Across this appears a new 1-story freight station of the Erie Railroad. The latter is at the N.W. corner; a vacant lot in
1922.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A similar view slightly north of the vantage point for No. 1. Note the W.P.A. surface car track removal program under operation. Crosstown traffic seen in the midground is upon Canal Street.
April 29, 1937.
W. P. A. photo.
5 Boroughs Project.
724134f-b.folder: Washington Street & Watts Street, Manhattan, NY

724134f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Watts Street
724134f-a.text:
(1)
Washington Street, west side, north from and including Watts Street and showing an empty lot at the S.W. corner of same; formerly the site of Nos. 450 to 454. Across this appears a new 1-story freight station of the Erie Railroad. The latter is at the N.W. corner; a vacant lot in

(2)

5 Boroughs Project.
724134f-a.folder: Washington Street & Watts Street, Manhattan, NY

724135f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Watts Street
724135f-a.text:
Washington Street, south from Watts Street, showing a W.~.A. track removal project. The block shown in the foreground
extends onto Watts and Dehbrosses Streets.
April 28, 1937
W.P.A.Photo
Five Boroughs Vroject
724135f-a.folder: Washington Street & Watts Street, Manhattan, NY

724305f-a.title: Manhattan: Watts Street - Washington Street
724305f-a.text:
142 and 140-136 Watts Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Washington Street. The 5-story tenement shown at the corner also bears
No. 457 Washington Street.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
724305f-a.folder: Watts Street & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY

724306f-a.title: Manhattan: Watts Street - Washington Street
724306f-a.text:
(1)
Watts Street, south side, west from Washington to West Streets, showing Nos. 149 to 157 standing after the demolition at the S.W. oorner of Wuashington Street. This consisted of Nos. 454 to 450 Washington Street; the first of which was the corner property and also
bore No. 147 Watts Street.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, as viewed from Washington Street and showing in the foreground that frontage. The structure marked "Towers" is a 5-story warehouse, No. 281-85 West Street, at the N.E. corner of Watts Street.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
724306f-a.folder: Watts Street & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY

(2)

August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

724304f-a.title: Manhattan: Watts Street - Washington Street
724304f-a.text:
(1) Watts Street, at Washinaton Street, showing Ireight yards. (2) Watts Street, southeast corner and Washington Street, lcokinr
across clearing at southwest corner eastwards.
P. L. Sperr  January 6, 1941
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2
